alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:20AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Smith, southeastern Franklin and southwestern Webster Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 520 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Bloomington, or 21 miles northeast of Phillipsburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Riverton around 540 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Inavale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
